column2: The contribution of the sectors covered by the EU ETS with respect to the EU Climate ambition should be of -62% compared to 2005
column5: The reduction of greenhouse gas emissions from the EU ETS sectors will likely have a positive impact on the reduction of antimicrobials for farmed animals and in aquaculture, as a cleaner environment can lead to healthier animals and reduced need for antimicrobials.

column2: The contribution of the sectors covered by the EU ETS with respect to the EU Climate ambition should be of -62% compared to 2005

column2: Member States shall collectively ensure a reduction of energy consumption of at least 11.7% in 2030 compared to the projections of the 2020 EU Reference Scenario
column5: The increased energy efficiency in the EU may lead to reduced energy consumption, potentially decreasing the demand for biofuels and affecting the sales of antimicrobials for farmed animals and in aquaculture.

column2: Member States shall make efforts to collectively contribute to the indicative Union primary energy consumption target amounting to no more than 992.5 Mtoe in 2030
column5: The reduction of primary energy consumption may lead to decreased energy availability for agricultural activities, potentially increasing the use of more hazardous pesticides to maintain crop yields.

column2: Each Member State shall ensure that at least 3% of the total floor area of heated and/or cooled buildings that are owned by public bodies is renovated each year
column5: The renovation of public buildings can lead to increased energy efficiency, reduced energy consumption, and a decreased carbon footprint, contributing to a fair, inclusive, and ethical value chain.

column2: Reduce buildings' final energy consumption by 14%
column5: The reduction of final energy consumption in buildings can lead to increased energy efficiency, reduced energy consumption, and a decreased carbon footprint, contributing to the availability of sustainable food.

column5: The increased energy renovation rate can lead to improved energy efficiency, reduced energy consumption, and a decreased carbon footprint, contributing to a fair, inclusive, and ethical value chain.
